required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD7 CAR T-cell for R/R CD7+ T Cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Humanized CD7 CAR T-cell Therapy for R/R CD7+ T Cell Lymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

collaborator.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School
The Affiliated Zhongshan Hospital of Dalian University
The First Affiliated Hospital of Dalian Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, open-label, multiple center and single arm phase 2 study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of T cells expressing humanized CD7 chimeric antigen receptors treatment for patients with refractory/relapsed CD7 positive T cell lymphoma.

primary_outcome.description: Number of patients who achieved response (complete response and partial response ) after treatment of CD7 CAR-T cell. Response will be assessed using the Lugano criteria.
Adverse events are evaluated with CTCAE V5.0

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who achieved complete response after treatment by CD7 CAR-T cell.
Duration of overall response will be assessed from the CAR-T cell infusion to progression, death or last follow-up.
PFS will be assessed from the CAR-T cell infusion to progression, death or last follow-up.
OS will be assessed from the CAR-T cell infusion to death or last follow-up.

clinical_study.condition: Refractory and Relapsed T Cell Lymphoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: CD7 positive relapsed or refractory T cell lymphoma
arm_group.description: Humanized CD7 CAR-T cells intravenously infused to patient with R/R T-NHL[ at a dose of (0.5- 5)x10^6 CD7 CAR-T cells/kg

intervention.description: Patients will receive infusion of CAR T-cells targeting CD7 to confirm the safety and efficacy of CD7 CAR T-Cells in CD7+ relapsed or refractory T cell lymphoma
intervention.arm_group_label: CD7 positive relapsed or refractory T cell lymphoma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥ 18 years
2. R/R T-NHL with measurable (≧1.5cm) lesions confirmed by pathological immunohistochemistry or flow cytometry
3. The expressions of both CD4 and CD8 are negative in patients with bone marrow involved
4. The Eastern Cooperative Oncoloy Group (ECOG) physical condition score ≤ 2 points
5. The main organ functions need to meet the following conditions:
A.Left ventricular ejection fraction ≥50% B.Creatinine ≤132umol/l or creatinine clearance ≥60 ml/min C.ALT and AST≤2.5 upper limitation of normal D.T-BIL≤2.0mg/dl E.SpO2 > 90%
6. Results of pregnant test should be negative, and agree to conception control during treatment and 1 year after CAR-T infusion
7. Expected survival exceeds 3 months
8. Written informed consent could be acquired
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Immunosuppressant medications or steroids were used within 2 weeks before cell collection, or need to use steroids or immunosuppressant medications more than two years
2. Patients with uncontrolled active infection
3. Active hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection
4. Patients with HIV infection
5. Severe acute or chronic graft-versus-host disease (GVHD)
6. Participated in any other drug research clinical trials within 30 days before enrollment
7. Prior CAR-T cells therapy within 3 months before enrollment
8. Prior allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation within 6 months before enrollment
9. Uncontrolled other tumor
10. Women in pregnancy, lactation or planning to become pregnant
11. The researcher considers inappropriate to participate in this research

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
